content: st in mc until the work measures 15cm / 6 measured from cast on edge 6 begin crown shaping as described below switching to the longer circular needle for magic loop or dpns when required crown shaping round 1 k14 k2tog to end round 2 and all subsequent even rounds knit round 3 k13 k2tog to end round 5 k12 k2tog to end round 7 k11 k2tog to end round 9 k10 k2tog to end 3 round 11 k9 k2tog to end round 13 k8 k2tog to end round 15 k7 k2tog to end round 17 k6 k2tog to end round 19 k5 k2tog to end round 21 k4 k2tog to end round 23 k3 k2tog to end round 25 k2 k2tog to end round 27 k1 k2tog to end round 29 k2tog to end 7 after completing round 29 of the crown shaping break your yarn leaving a long tail using your tapestry needle thread the tail through the remaining 9 stitches by slipping the stitches off the needle onto the yarn once all stitches have been worked pull the yarn tight and thread the tail to the inside of the hat weave in the tail and all remaining threads 8 wet block if desired blocking is recommended to even the stitch detail and to achieve the required gauge
